booklist.title: The Grapes of Wrath
booklist.author: John Steinbeck
booklist.description: An epic of the Great Depression chronicles the Dust Bowl migration of the 1930s and tells the story of one Oklahoma farm family, the Joads.

booklist.title: Great Expectations
booklist.author: Charles Dickens
booklist.description: This is a gripping tale of crime and guilt, revenge and reward

booklist.title: Wuthering Heights
booklist.author: Emily Brontë
booklist.description: Wuthering Heights is a wild, passionate story of the intense and almost demonic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

booklist.title: Sense and Sensibility
booklist.author: Jane Austen
booklist.description: The sisters learn that sense must mix with sensibility if they are to find personal happiness in a society where status and money govern the rules of love.

booklist.title: Vanity Fair
booklist.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
booklist.description: This is a novel without a hero, satirizing society in early 19th-century Britain.

booklist.title: Middlemarch
booklist.author: George Eliot
booklist.description: The author ortrays a whole community--tradespeople, middle classes, country gentry--in the rising provincial town of Middlemarch, circa 1830.

master-booklist.title: The Grapes of Wrath
master-booklist.author: John Steinbeck
master-booklist.description: An epic of the Great Depression chronicles the Dust Bowl migration of the 1930s and tells the story of one Oklahoma farm family, the Joads.

master-booklist.title: Great Expectations
master-booklist.author: Charles Dickens
master-booklist.description: This is a gripping tale of crime and guilt, revenge and reward

master-booklist.title: Wuthering Heights
master-booklist.author: Emily Brontë
master-booklist.description: Wuthering Heights is a wild, passionate story of the intense and almost demonic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

master-booklist.title: Sense and Sensibility
master-booklist.author: Jane Austen
master-booklist.description: The sisters learn that sense must mix with sensibility if they are to find personal happiness in a society where status and money govern the rules of love.

master-booklist.title: Vanity Fair
master-booklist.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
master-booklist.description: This is a novel without a hero, satirizing society in early 19th-century Britain.

master-booklist.title: Middlemarch
master-booklist.author: George Eliot
master-booklist.description: The author ortrays a whole community--tradespeople, middle classes, country gentry--in the rising provincial town of Middlemarch, circa 1830.

master-booklist.title: David Copperfield
master-booklist.author: Charles Dickens
master-booklist.description: David Copperfield is the story of a young man's adventures on his journey from an unhappy and impoverished childhood to the discovery of his vocation as a successful novelist.

master-booklist.title: Oliver Twist
master-booklist.author: Charles Dickens
master-booklist.description: The story of Oliver Twist - orphaned, and set upon by evil and adversity from his first breath - shocked readers when it was published.

master-booklist.title: Nicholas Nickleby
master-booklist.author: Charles Dickens
master-booklist.description: When Nicholas Nickleby is left penniless after his father's death, he appeals to his wealthy uncle to help him find work and to protect his mother and sister.

master-booklist.title: A Tale of Two Cities
master-booklist.author: Charles Dickens
master-booklist.description: In the early days of the French Revolution, a young Englishman determines to do the utmost to save the husband of the woman he loves from the guillotine.

master-booklist.title: Emma
master-booklist.author: Jane Austen
master-booklist.description: Beautiful, clever, rich—and single—Emma Woodhouse is perfectly content with her life and sees no need for either love or marriage.

master-booklist.title: Mansfield Park
master-booklist.author: Jane Austen
master-booklist.description: Taken from the poverty of her parents' home in Portsmouth, Fanny Price is brought up with her rich cousins at Mansfield Park, acutely aware of her humble rank and with her cousin Edmund as her sole ally.

master-booklist.title: The Poisonwood Bible
master-booklist.author: Barbara Kingsolver
master-booklist.description: It is a story told by the wife and four daughters of Nathan Price, a fierce, evangelical Baptist who takes his family and mission to the Belgian Congo in 1959.

master-booklist.title: Prodigal Summer
master-booklist.author: Barbara Kingsolver
master-booklist.description: The novel is a hymn to wildness that celebrates the prodigal spirit of human nature, and of nature itself.

master-booklist.title: Matterhorn
master-booklist.author: Karl Marlantes
master-booklist.description: It is the timeless story of a young Marine lieutenant, Waino Mellas, and his comrades in Bravo Company, who are dropped into the mountain jungle of Vietnam as boys and forced to fight their way into manhood.

master-booklist.author: George Orwell
master-booklist.description: 1984 presents a startling and haunting vision of the world, so powerful that it is completely convincing from start to finish.

master-booklist.title: The Alchemist
master-booklist.author: Paulo Coelho
master-booklist.description: Santiago a Andalusian shepherd boy, travels from his homeland in Spain to the Egyptian desert in search of a treasure buried in the Pyramids.

master-booklist.title: Sophie's World
master-booklist.author: Jostein Gaarder
master-booklist.description: A page-turning novel that is also an exploration of the great philosophical concepts of Western thought, Sophie's World has fired the imagination of readers all over the world.

master-booklist.title: Mrs. Dalloway
master-booklist.author: Virginia Woolf
master-booklist.description: Virginia Woolf details Clarissa Dalloway’s preparations for a party of which she is to be hostess, exploring the hidden springs of thought and action in one day of a woman’s life.
